intro: Mandevilla oaxacensis, commonly known as the Oaxacan mandevilla, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its vigorous growth and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright red or orange flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a glossy texture. Mandevilla oaxacensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in warm climates.
